meanings.sent1: She sublated his argument with solid evidence.
meanings.sent2: The loud music sublated the sound of the approaching train.
meanings.sent3: The magician sublated the rabbit out of the hat, making it disappear completely.
meanings.sent4: Her smile sublated all his worries, leaving him feeling at ease.
meanings.sent5: The storm sublated all traces of the sandcastle, washing it away completely.

meanings.definition: To preserve or include within a larger whole
meanings.sent1: The museum sublated the ancient artifact in its collection.
meanings.sent2: The recipe sublated the secret ingredient in the final dish.
meanings.sent3: The chef sublated the unique flavor into the sauce, enhancing its taste.
meanings.sent4: His story sublated her memories, intertwining them into a beautiful narrative.
meanings.sent5: The artist sublated the historical context into the painting, adding depth to its meaning.

meanings.sent1: He sublated his fear of heights to climb the tall mountain.
meanings.sent2: The team sublated their previous record, achieving a new milestone.
meanings.sent3: The superhero sublated the villain's powers, emerging victorious in the end.
meanings.sent4: Her determination sublated all obstacles in her path, leading her to success.
meanings.sent5: The student sublated his own expectations, scoring higher than he thought possible.
